Dialogue: No, not really. Good kid, never been in any trouble.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Her part in this I can't figure... but I will.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Don't worry, we'll find her.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Let's hit the road, sooner we get a move on sooner we'll find her.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: God damn bitch, what the fuck are you waiting for... Charles Nelson Reilly don't know shit...

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Watch that bitch, she's thinking about that Klugman bangin' Brett Sommers, pick motherfucking Richard Dawson.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: He's the fucking slick jack Match Game man, mamma.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: Where do they find these people?

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: No they couldn't, somebody had to see something.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: I'm sure there's a logical explanation.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Turn up this road.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: I seem to remember another farm set way back off the road where the car was found. I'm not sure if anyone lives there anymore, but it's worth a look.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: I'm gonna see if anybody's home. You and Mr. Willis take a look around the grounds for any sign of anything.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Right...  ...come on.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Otis! Otis! Come quick, there's cops outside.

Dialogue: What! God damn, how many?

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: What? How many?

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Don't worry about it.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I don't know. I only saw one.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: I'm sure there's more than that... fucking pigs always travel in packs...  ...here, take this.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: What should I do?

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Go down stairs and play nice... I'm a gonna go 'round back and handle things like I always fucking do.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Shit, don't these packrat hillbillies throw anything away?

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Yeah, I hear it... where's it coming from?

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Anybody in there?

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: I ain't got a warrant.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Shit... fuck procedure.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Well hello, officer.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm sorry for disturbing you this fine afternoon.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Aw, you ain't disturbing me, but it kind of looks like rain, don't ya think?

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: My name is Lt. Wydell, I'd like to ask you a few questions.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Questions? Well, heck, I'll tell you anything you want to know.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: I appreciate your cooperation. I'm looking for a missing girl...  ...this girl here, Denise Willis... have you seen her?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Well, I... mmmmm... no, I ain't seen her, sorry.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Please, could I please come in and talk to you for a minute? Maybe you could take a better look at the picture... might stir up something.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I um... no, I don't think so...

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Please, just a minute.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Oh, alright... I guess I can trust you... being a man of the law and all.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Oh, you are very welcome... Lord knows how I love a man in uniform.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Jesus Christ.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Think... do any of these kids look familiar in any way?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: No, I can't say that I ever seen 'em before...  ...he looks familiar, is he on TV?

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Wydell.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Excuse me for a second.

Speaker: wydell
Dialogue: Over.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: We found one.

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Wydell! Over! Wydell! Over!

Speaker: naish
Dialogue: Fuck, go to the car... call for backup. Tell 'em officer down.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Hands up, bitch!

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Turn around, real slow... piggy-pie.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Interlock your fingers behind your head...  ...do it!

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Kneel.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: Get those motherfucker... those high water bitches and rocketship daisies... kill 'em, kill 'em.

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Drink up, it's party time.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Enjoy your last night...  ...where's Otis?

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Oh, he's coming, he got something real special this year.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Quiet, quiet, you know he won't come down with all this hoop-dee-doo bouncing off the walls. Now, calm down.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: I shot an elephant in my pajamas this morning... how he got in my pajamas I'll never know.

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Grampa, shhhhhhhh.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: Then we tried to remove the tusks, but they were embedded in so firmly that we couldn't budge 'em.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Let him finish.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: Of course, in Alabama the Tuscaloosa, but that's entirely irrelephant.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: ...Who's your Daddy?

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: I'm the one who brings the devil's brandy...

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Who's your Daddy!

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Yes! I'm the one who beats you when you're bad...

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Who's your Daddy!

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Who's your Daddy!

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: I'm the one who loves you when you're fucking dead!

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: And you, the great rusher of fools, what were you after...  ...well, I can see the disappointment on your sad little puppy face... so I'm gonna do you a favor, a big, big favor. You owe me, boy. I'm gonna let you meet the old bastard.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: That's a horse's ass alright, I told you.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Baby, roll that old love machine over here, so this boy can meet his hero.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: ...why so sad? Isn't this what you begged for? There he is, the living legend himself, ta da Dr. Satan. Now, don't get shy on me... ask your hero some questions, don't blow this last in a lifetime opportunity.

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: Zarkoff, I will conquer the sea, the air, the earth... the universe.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Look at the way he lights up... Grampa just loves meeting his fans.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Aw gee whiz, I'm so excited... I really think you're the coolest... you're tops on the playground, cooler than the Fonzie.

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Oh, oh pick me, pick me... I have a question.

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: I was wondering Mr. Satan sir, do you like to kiss on the first date or is that considered slutty?

Speaker: grampa
Dialogue: What the fuck are you saying? Who the hell is talking to me?

Dialogue: Come on, my babies are getting restless.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Alright, alright. Cut 'em down, it's time they get what they came here for.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Hold this. Point it over here.

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Hey happy-boy, step your ass up here.

Dialogue: Take his gag out, it's more fun with the screaming.

Dialogue: Yeah, I like the screaming too... it's so much more exciting.

Dialogue: Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.

Speaker: baby
Dialogue: Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.

Dialogue: Let us go, please... let the girls go.

Dialogue: Wait, I want to say good-bye.

Dialogue: Bye sweety, we could of been great together.

Dialogue: Aw, honey you know I can't do that.

Dialogue: We won't tell anybody.

Dialogue: Please, please this is insane. You can't do this.

Dialogue: No! Let me get her...  ...Ma, Otis is having all the fun... can I get her?

Dialogue: That's true, Otis... not that we're having a bad time, but...

Speaker: otis
Dialogue: Well, go get her.

Dialogue: "Shoo! Shoo!" said the maiden...

Dialogue: ..."Come maiden," said the rabbit...  ...sit on my tail and go with me to my rabbit hutch.

Dialogue: We've got get out of here, we got get out of here.

Dialogue: Think, think. Try to open the lid, try to kick a hole in the wood.

Speaker: denise
Dialogue: I can't... I can't move my arms. I hurt so much.

Speaker: jerry
Dialogue: I know, but we can make it out of here. We can do it.

Dialogue: That was good babe, just keep doing that.

Dialogue: That's not me. I didn't... I'm not doing that.

Dialogue: Someone is out there...  ...help, we're in here!

Dialogue: Jerry...  ...is that you?
